title: devboard
description: Devboard is a personal project built with Next.js 14 (pages router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to serve as a modern and visually appealing developer dashboard. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, showcasing key information and tools relevant to a developer's workflow. The repository explores a combination of technologies for building robust and feature-rich web applications.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS for visualizing and interacting with data from a Robofleet robotics system. This project aims to provide a user-friendly dashboard to monitor robot status, sensor data, and mission progress, facilitating efficient robot management and data analysis within a Robofleet environment. It's a project focused on creating a comprehensive tool for Robofleet users.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: crud-expense-tracker is a simple web application built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML that allows users to track their expenses. Leveraging Material-UI for a clean and intuitive interface, this project implements Create, Read, Update, and Delete (CRUD) operations, enabling users to easily add, view, modify, and remove expense entries. This serves as a practical demonstration of fundamental web development principles and efficient data management.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, designed to manage and interact with data through a web interface. Utilizing HTML, CSS, and shell scripting for various aspects of the project, this repository showcases a practical example of building a web application from backend to frontend, covering key concepts like database interaction, API development, and user interface design. It serves as a project template and learning resource for those interested in building similar Python-based web applications.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML and Python. This repository explores techniques for displaying geographical data and insights on web-based maps, providing a visual and engaging way to understand spatial information. The project utilizes these technologies to create dynamic maps and explore potential applications of map-based data representation.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [Insert a brief, impactful description of the project's core functionality or goal - e.g., "building a modern, customizable note-taking application" or "exploring efficient data visualization techniques"]. This repository showcases [Mention key aspects or features of the project - e.g., "a clean architecture, comprehensive testing, and a user-friendly interface"] and serves as a learning resource for [Mention the project's target audience or purpose - e.g., "developers interested in modern web development practices" or "exploring innovative solutions for [problem area]"].

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard interface built with Next.js, TypeScript, JavaScript, and CSS. This repository provides a functional and visually appealing dashboard template, demonstrating best practices for building dynamic web applications with Next.js, including data fetching, routing, and component-based architecture, making it a valuable resource for developers looking to learn or implement similar features.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. By tracking sleep patterns and calculating the difference between actual sleep and ideal sleep needs, this application provides insights into sleep habits and promotes better sleep hygiene. This project serves as a practical example of utilizing TypeScript for front-end development and demonstrates key concepts in web application design.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that serves as a dynamic and collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. Utilizing a modern web framework, it provides a user-friendly interface for capturing, visualizing, and prioritizing ideas, making it a valuable tool for project planning, team collaboration, and individual creativity.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, written using LaTeX for professional typesetting and compiled into a visually appealing PDF document. It also includes an HTML version for online viewing and accessibility. This project showcases my skills in document creation, typesetting, and web development, acting as a personal portfolio and a template for resume generation.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js (TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS) that facilitates simple and efficient voting on various proposals. This project focuses on providing a user-friendly interface for creating, participating in, and analyzing voting results, offering a streamlined solution for decision-making within small groups or organizations. The repository encompasses all aspects of the voting platform, from frontend design and user interaction to backend logic and data management.

title: atg-world
description: atg-world is a project showcasing a dynamic and interactive web experience built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository focuses on implementing [mention a key feature or purpose from the README, e.g., a 3D globe visualization, a data-driven dashboard, etc.] and explores concepts related to [mention 1-2 key topics, e.g., web development best practices, interactive data visualization, front-end architecture, etc.]. It serves as a demonstration of front-end skills and a practical application of modern web technologies.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase for tracking IoT assets. It leverages modern web technologies to provide a user-friendly interface for managing and monitoring the location and status of assets in real-time. The project showcases a practical application of Supabase for data storage and authentication, while utilizing Tailwind CSS for a responsive and aesthetically pleasing design.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project showcasing a customizable and interactive event calendar built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository provides a functional and stylish event calendar that allows users to dynamically add, view, and manage events, offering a practical solution for scheduling and event management applications.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide interactive AI-powered conversations. This project showcases a modern development workflow, combining a robust backend with a dynamic frontend to deliver a seamless user experience, exploring topics such as AI interaction and real-time communication.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, houses a collection of projects focused on applying Python to practical finance problems. It explores various financial concepts and techniques through hands-on coding exercises, offering a practical resource for learning and implementing financial analysis using Python.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting designed to visualize and analyze log data generated by the Robot Operating System (ROS). This project provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and inspecting ROS logs, aiding in debugging and understanding robot behavior.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a modern e-commerce web application built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) for a visually appealing and responsive user interface. This project leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, providing a type-safe and performant shopping experience for purchasing fruits. It showcases best practices in front-end development and e-commerce implementation, focusing on clean code and a user-friendly design.
